question: <image 1> On the basis of style, this work can be attributed to
options: ['Paul Cézanne', 'Claude Monet', 'José María Velasco', 'Vincent van Gogh']
description: The image is a grayscale painting depicting a landscape scene. The sky is filled with swirling clouds, rendered in thick, expressive brushstrokes that create a dynamic and turbulent atmosphere. The clouds vary in shades of gray, with some areas appearing lighter and others darker, suggesting depth and movement. Below the sky, there is a field with patches of grass and shrubs, also painted with visible, textured brushstrokes. On the right side of the painting, there are tall, dark trees, possibly cypress trees, which stand out against the lighter background. The overall style of the painting is characterized by its bold, impasto technique and the use of short, choppy brushstrokes to convey emotion and movement. The composition and technique are reminiscent of the post-impressionist style.
